issue.title: More missing allocator-extended constructors for unordered containers

discussion.p: The resolution of LWG missed constructors accepting a range or initializer list and allocator.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4582.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Add to the synopsis in p3:
Add to the synopsis in p3:
Add to the synopsis in p3:

discussion.note: 2016-06, Oulu — Daniel comments and provides new wording
discussion.p: During the LWG discussion of this issue it has been observed, that the interpretation of the embedded see below is not really clear and that we should split declaration and definition of the new overloads, so that we have a place that allows us to specify what "see below" stands for. In addition, the new wording wraps the "see below" as "size_type(see below)" to clarify the provided expression type, similar as we did for the default constructor of unordered_map.

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N4594.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_map(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_map(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The number of buckets is implementation-defined.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_multimap(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_multimap(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The number of buckets is implementation-defined.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_set(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_set(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The number of buckets is implementation-defined.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_multiset(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_multiset(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The number of buckets is implementation-defined.

discussion.p: We decided to improve the added Remarks: elements by changing from the previous form:

blockquote.p: Remarks: The number of buckets is implementation-defined.
Remarks: The initial number of buckets supplied by the size_type argument is implementation-defined.

resolution.p: This resolution is relative to N4687.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_map(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_map(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The initial number of buckets supplied by the size_type argument is implementation-defined.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_multimap(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_multimap(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The initial number of buckets supplied by the size_type argument is implementation-defined.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_set(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_set(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The initial number of buckets supplied by the size_type argument is implementation-defined.

li.p: Add to the synopsis in p3:
Insert the following new prototype specification just after p2

pre.ins: unordered_multiset(initializer_list<value_type> il, const allocator_type& a) : unordered_multiset(il, size_type(see below), hasher(), key_equal(), a) { }

p.ins: -?- Remarks: The initial number of buckets supplied by the size_type argument is implementation-defined.
